question.question_text: Will Israel invade Lebanon before October 1, 2024?
question.background_info:
Tensions between Israel and Hezbollah, a Lebanese militant group, have escalated dramatically. Recently, Hezbollah launched over 200 rockets into Israel in retaliation for the killing of one of its senior commanders by an Israeli strike. This attack represents one of the largest confrontations in the ongoing conflict along the Lebanon-Israel border, with significant military actions taken by both sides. Israel responded with strikes on various towns in southern Lebanon, targeting Hezbollah's military structures.

The conflict, which intensified following the outbreak of war in Gaza, has displaced tens of thousands of people on both sides of the border and resulted in numerous casualties. Israel considers Hezbollah its most direct threat, estimating the group possesses an arsenal of 150,000 rockets and missiles, including precision-guided ones. The international community, including the U.S. and France, is actively working to prevent these skirmishes from escalating into an all-out war that could impact the broader region. Despite diplomatic efforts, Israeli officials have indicated that they might decide to go to war in Lebanon if a diplomatic solution cannot be achieved.

From the credible sources, it must be clear that the troops are acting deliberately on orders of the Government of Israel and without permission of the currently recognized Government of Lebanon or the assent of the United Nations.

The announcements must describe events that take place (at least in part) between the launch of this question and October 1, 2024.

For the purpose of this question, Lebanese territory is determined by the 2000 Blue Line.

## Q5: How accurate have polls been in predicting the outcomes of past US Presidential elections?

In the 2016 election, public opinion polls overestimated Hillary Clinton’s win margin by just one percentage point, making it the fourth most accurate in the last 10 U.S. presidential elections \[[3](https://www.thecrosstab.com/2017/01/03/history-polling-error-us-uk/#:~:text=Hillary%20Clinton%20bested%20Donald%20Trump%20in%20the%202016%20election%20popular%20vote%20by%20a%20margin%20of%202)\]\[[6](https://www.thecrosstab.com/2017/01/03/history-polling-error-us-uk/#:~:text=Historically%2C%20pre-election%20polls%20are%20relatively%20good%20indicators%20of%20election%20outcomes)\]. ## Q6: What is the historical impact of strong media engagement on the success of Presidential candidates?

However, the impact of media engagement during the general election is less pronounced. By the time of the general election, most voters have already formed strong opinions about the candidates, and party identification becomes a dominant factor in voting decisions. For example, in the 2012 election, nearly 70% of voters had decided whom to vote for before September, indicating that media influence is more limited at this stage \[[12](https://www.vox.com/2016/7/14/12184766/media-boost-donald-trump-coverage#:~:text=However%2C%20as%20Vanderbilt%20political%20scientist%20Larry%20Bartels%E2%80%99s%20research%20suggests%2C%20a%20general%20election%20campaign%20for%20the%20presidency%20is%20probably%20not%20the%20best%20place%20to%20find%20evidence%20of%20media%20influence)\]. In summary, while strong media engagement can significantly influence candidate success during the primaries, its impact diminishes during the general election as voters' preferences become more entrenched.

## Q7: What is the historical impact of key endorsements on a candidate’s chances of winning the US Presidential Election?
Answer:
The historical impact of key endorsements on a candidate’s chances of winning the US Presidential Election is generally limited, though there are notable exceptions.
